title: Arabia Steamboat Museum
original_text: We stumbled upon this awesome museum while traveling cross country for a move. You buy the tickets in the gift shop and go below for the museum itself. Tickets are a little pricey for adults. Not all of the audio video was working and it could be a touch more accessible for kids, but we learned a lot about the time period (1850s) by walking through the exhibit. My kids were fascinated by all the artifacts.
gpt3_finetuned_v1: My family had a great time at the Trap House.  We learned a lot, and had fun competing in contests that we saw played out in movies on a huge projection screen.  I recommend this place for any family that wants an entertaining afternoon.
gpt3.5_turbo:
I recently visited this museum and I must say, it was an amazing experience. The exhibits are beautifully curated and the information provided is both informative and engaging. I especially enjoyed the hands-on activities and interactive displays, which made learning about history and culture fun and exciting.

The layout of the museum is spacious and easy to navigate. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, always eager to answer questions and provide additional information. The museum also offers a variety of programs and events, which enhances the overall experience for visitors.

Parking is easily accessible and the location is conveniently located near public transportation. The admission price is reasonable for the quality of the exhibits and the overall experience. I highly recommend this museum for anyone looking to learn about history and culture in a fun and engaging way.

title: Breakout KC Escape Room | River Market
original_text:
This was a great experience! We did the Sporting KC room with 5 adults plus a 5-year old and loved it! No spoilers, so all I'll say is don't let the small room deceive you. Plenty of clever things to discover.

They will give as many hints as you would like. Only the first requested 3 hints are free though. Anything beyond those 3 result in a 3-minute penalty each. You still get a full hour to break out, no matter how many hints you use. You're time will just look longer than one hour. This is how people get scores of 64 minutes, even though you only have an hour max.

The do give free hints if they see that you're stuck. These do not count against your 3 free requested hints, nor do they penalize your time.

My advice for the uninitiated is to not be afraid to use the hints! Especially if you're not going to try again at a later date. Enjoy the puzzles, but don't let them frustrate you. Make sure someone is keeping track of time so that you can pace the free hints.

The parking was a bit confusing. The building is close to some apartments and there's a few signs that explicitly say "no parking" for break out KC. Parking directly in front of the entrance says "for tenants and patrons only", which we had no idea what that meant. We ended up parallel parking in the street, just to be safe.
gpt3_finetuned_v1: Very good experience for my first escape room experience! I went with a group of 12 total, and it was a great experience for all of us to work together. The food was delicious and the servers were very attentive. I would definitely recommend going here!
gpt3.5_turbo: I recently visited this escape room center and had an absolute blast! The facility was clean, well-maintained and had a variety of engaging escape rooms to choose from. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and ensured that we had a great experience. The puzzles were challenging yet solvable, which made it all the more exciting. The decor and themes of the rooms were also on point, creating a truly immersive experience. Even better, the pricing was quite reasonable for the quality of fun that we had. Overall, if you're looking for a fun and engaging activity for a group of friends or family, this escape room center is definitely worth a visit!

original_text: Have been here multiple times with average experiences, this last time, however, sealed the deal for me. Ordered a lunch special and got 1, ONE! tamale (or enchilada, whatever). One? Really? We ordered take out so I called back & was told, 'yep, you get one!' But that's not what the menu said; silly me.
gpt3_finetuned_v1: Nice Freshet to Mexican food
gpt3.5_turbo:

The shrimp tacos were my personal favorite - they were perfectly seasoned and had just the right amount of kick. The guacamole was also some of the best I've had - it was fresh and tasted homemade.

The pricing was very reasonable for the quality of food and service we received. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area looking for some delicious Mexican cuisine. It will not disappoint!

title: Wyndham Garden Cross Lanes Charleston
original_text:
Not a great experience overall. The only redeeming factors about the hotel are the price and the friendly employees. I stayed here while doing business in the area. I figured that swimming in one of 2 pools would be a great way to relax afterwards, especially for the price. Well, it could have definitely been better.

The first thing I noticed about the hotel is the smell of marijuana in the elevator. Then, when I got up to the hotel room, I tried to get in with the key cards they gave me. It took me no less than 10 tries to successfully use this card. I swiped it almost the same way 10 times, and it magically opened on the 10th.

The room itself was somewhat chilly when I got in. I changed the temperature and it started to heat up quickly. But, there was another odd burnt smell coming from the conditioner. It was dirty, too. Breakfast was decent. Food was nothing special, but the guy serving breakfast was awesome. Very friendly, even though I just had some coffee he offered me some freshly cooked food.

The pools were nice. Not too many people at night or during the day. Expect it to be more crowded at 9 pm than at 11 am, though. There were loads of what seemed to be pool algae all around the pool (dark green in color) but the water itself was clean. Good ambiance with the rocks and faux plants. Not too cold or too warm. Decent fitness center, too. Treadmill worked fine, they had dumbbells and a few other strength training machines. Pretty basic and small.

It's a bit tough to sleep during the night. They didn't give any pillows or blankets for the 2nd room with the pull out bed. You can hear everything and I was a bit concerned about a door near my room. People walking in and out all the time and you will surely hear some of that.

All in all, if you want a cheap hotel with 2 pools, this may be the place. The location is pretty convenient and the employees were very friendly. There are some cleanliness, room entrance, and sleeping issues, though.
gpt3_finetuned_v1: Good place for family for enjoyment. Service kind of slow food was all right.
gpt3.5_turbo:
I recently stayed at this hotel during my business trip and I must say, it was a great experience. The staff was very friendly and always ready to help with anything we needed. The rooms were spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The hotel location is very convenient, with easy access to transportation and nearby restaurants.

The complimentary breakfast was amazing, with a wide variety of dishes to choose from. The hotel facilities were also great, with a gym that had all the necessary equipment for a good workout and a swimming pool with sparkling clean water.

Overall, I had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient place to stay. The staff went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable, and I will definitely stay here again!

title: Quest Motel
original_text:
We will be very happy to recommend the Quest Motel in Whitewood, SK. Great beds and pillows, good size TV, fridge, microwave, air conditioner, chairs and table outside each room. Nice big BBQ in the gazebos with tables. Plus a fire pit and quiet location with next to no highway noise.

Very reasonable price. Friendly staff/owners.

Looks like most of the place has been recently renovated.

I would rate it 9/10.
gpt3_finetuned_v1: Best place to get a good night's rest and the breakfast treats in the lobby hit the spot. A great experience all around.
gpt3.5_turbo:

Although the motel was not fancy or luxurious, it served its purpose as a comfortable stopover on my journey. I appreciated the quiet atmosphere, which allowed me to get a good night's sleep before continuing my travels.

title: Lalibela Ethiopian Restaurant
original_text:
This is one of my favorite places in New Haven. I’m an NYC expat always searching for places that remind me of my homeland. The food here is homemade, tasty and authentic. I’ve seen the reviews where people complain about the service,  and how only 1 person waits all the tables. Totally understandable if you’re in a major rush. It seems that the restaurant is family owned and operated which, to me, is a big plus. If you’re looking for fast food, this is the wrong place. If you’re looking for great food, home style vibes, great culture and a meal that will nourish your soul, come here.
By the way, don’t embarrass yourself by asking for a fork. Live a little and use your hands.
gpt3_finetuned_v1: The food is delicious and the items on the menu are very affordable.
gpt3.5_turbo:
I recently visited an Ethiopian restaurant in my neighborhood and I must say, I was blown away! The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with traditional Ethiopian decor and music playing in the background.

The food was simply amazing! The traditional Ethiopian dishes were served on a communal platter with injera, a type of sourdough bread, as the utensil. The flavors were bold and complex, with a mix of spicy and savory elements. The vegetarian options were also fantastic, with plenty of variety.

The staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the menu, and they made sure that we had a great experience from start to finish. The prices were reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food.

I highly recommend this Ethiopian restaurant to anyone who is looking for a unique and delicious dining experience. It's definitely worth visiting and I will definitely be coming back again and again!

title: The Westin Hilton Head Island Resort & Spa

title: Denver Zoo

Highly recommend going here, just know it's probably gonna be busy if you go during the summer.
